title: Resources
text:
Talks
Source code and slide decks from recent talks, built using Quarto. Pressing the S key brings up speaker notes if you’re after the full experience.






EcoAssets: streamlining access to data from Australian environmental research infrastructures


Ecological Society of Australia 2023


source code • slide deck









Continental-scale biodiversity data assessment using the Atlas of Living Australia


Victorian Biodiversity Conference 2023


source code • slide deck







Tutorials
Posts covering topics on data cleaning, analysis, and visualisation, with a focus on biodiversity data.






Combining multiple species distributions on one map with hexagons and points









Alternatives to box plots: Using beeswarm and raincloud plots to summarise ecological data









Multiple colour scales in choropleth maps with ggnewscale

title: Publications
text:
Peer-reviewed publications
Boysen K, Perkins SL, Hunjan S, Oliver P, Gardner M, Balasubramaniam S, J Melville (2022) Diversity and phylogenetic relationships of haemosporidian and hemogregarine parasites in Australian lizards. Molecular Phylogenetics and Evolution 167: 107358.
Balasubramaniam S, Mulder RA, Sunnucks P, Pavlova A, Melville J (2017) MHC class II β exon 2 variation in pardalotes (Pardalotidae) is shaped by selection, recombination and gene conversion. Immunogenetics 69: 101-111.
Balasubramaniam S, Bray RD, Mulder RA, Sunnucks P, Pavlova A, Melville J (2016) New data from basal Australian songbird lineages show that complex structure of MHC class II β genes has early evolutionary origins within passerines. BMC Evolutionary Biology 16:112.
Balasubramaniam S, Mulder RA, Sunnucks P, Pavlova A, Amos JN, Melville J (2013) Prevalence and diversity of avian haematozoa in three species of Australian passerine. Emu 113:353-358.
Amos N, Balasubramaniam S, Grootendorst L, Harrisson K, Lill A, Mac Nally RC, Pavlova A, Radford JQ, Takeuchi N, Thomson JR, Sunnucks P (2013) Little evidence that condition, stress indicators, sex ratio, or homozygosity are related to landscape or habitat attributes in declining woodland birds. Journal of Avian Biology 44:45-54.
Balasubramaniam S, Guay P-J (2008) Purple swamphens (Porphyrio porphyrio) attempting to prey upon black swan (Cygnus atratus) eggs and preying upon a cygnet on an urban lake in Melbourne, Australia. Wilson Journal of Ornithology 120:633-635.


Technical reports
Balasubramaniam S, Sumner J (2021) Genetic analysis of captive and wild populations of the Bush Stone-curlew Burhinus grallarius. Technical report prepared for DELWP. 29 pp.
Balasubramaniam S (2020) Plains-wanderer genetic analysis: A comparison of wild and captive-bred individuals. Technical report prepared for Plains-wanderer National Recovery Team. 19 pp.
Balasubramaniam S (2020) Population structure in the Hooded Plover Thinornis cucullatus. Technical report prepared for BirdLife Australia. 18 pp.
Rowe K, Balasubramaniam S (2020) Plains-wanderer acoustic monitoring: song meter detection space. Technical report prepared for DELWP. 16 pp.
Balasubramaniam S (2019) Genetic analysis of the Plains-wanderer Pedionomus torquatus. Technical report prepared for Zoos Victoria and Taronga Conservation Society Australia. 19 pp.


Theses
Balasubramaniam S (2016) Evolution and ecology of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) genes in south-eastern Australian passerines. Doctoral Thesis. School of BioSciences, The University of Melbourne.
Balasubramaniam S (2007) Male incubation effort and extra-pair paternity in the Black Swan (Cygnus atratus). Honours Thesis. School of BioSciences, The University of Melbourne.

title: Projects
text:
feathers


feathers is an R package that contains colour palettes inspired by the plumage of Australian birds. For species exhibiting sexual dimorphism, I have used female colours.









Variations on a theme


Sometimes I make art in R (rtistry). These projects are spaces for me to explore a single idea and experiment with code.









VictualVerses


A Shiny app that generates three-line verses in the style of haiku. A random word is chosen from “Mrs. Beeton’s Dictionary of Every-Day Cookery”, and the following 17 syllables are output in lines of 5-7-5(ish) syllables.









Manky Parrots


Manky Parrots is a citizen science project that maps the incidence of psittacine beak and feather disease (PBFD) in Australia to understand the spread of the disease in the wild.









misc.


Links to repositories where I’ve dabbled in this, that, and the other. Sometimes they involve maps, sometimes not.

title: Shandiya Balasubramaniam
text:
As the Decision Support Program Lead at the Atlas of Living Australia, my work focuses on streamlining reproducible pathways for accessing and analysing open data. When I’m not coding for work or looking at birds, I enjoy making art in R. Once upon a time I was an academic.

Experience
Board Observer, The Observership Program (2024)
Data Analyst, Atlas of Living Australia (2022-present)
Senior Geospatial Data Analyst, Environment Protection Authority Victoria (2021)
Associate Data Analyst, Environment Protection Authority Victoria (2020)
Ian Potter Biodiversity Research Fellow, Museums Victoria (2016-2020)


Education
PhD, University of Melbourne (2016)
Thesis: Evolution and ecology of major histocompatibility complex (MHC) genes in south-eastern Australian passerines
BSc (Hons), University of Melbourne (2007)
